rationale: No intensifier or comparative directly modifies a risk-adjective.
The segment reports flock size factually without using high-potency verbs or metaphors.
The segment describes the size of an infected flock, but does not use a moderate verb paired with significant scale or impact.
The segment reports the size of an infected flock but contains no explicit calming language.
No minimiser ('only', 'just', 'merely', 'a single', 'few') combined with an explicit scale contrast.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
The segment describes the size of an infected flock, not capabilities or preparedness.
Reports the numerical metric of flock size ('more than 2.7 million chickens') using standard description.
